job_title: Registered Nurse in Little Rock, AR
pros: people, pay, kids, food, PTO, and benefits
cons: shift work, nothing else. i enjoyed working here

job_title: PMHNP-BC in Ocala, FL
pros: Above average salary, excellent benefits, helpful and knowledgeable MAs
cons: Arrogant mid-level managers and other NPs who think they're physicians because they earned a doctorate as a nurse practitioner. Some were rude in fact, and judgmental. Some of them are right out of college and challenge everything we 21 year veterans say.

job_title: Fcm Case Manager in Ocala, FL
pros: Helping kids cope with their instant changes. Advocating for those who have no voice. Doing your best to protect those who are hurting.
cons: Too many cases that need attention. Turn over rate is high. It’s not for the weak.

job_title: Behavioral Health RN in Ocala, FL
pros: It is a challenging work place
cons: There is a high turnover rate

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Ocala, FL
pros: Good benefits, plenty of Paid Time Off,  mission
cons: No real direction from management or directors, everyone seems to pass the buck to lower level staff and then fires them when they fail to do the job of the bosses.  Constant changes in the way programs are run and very little respect or regard for staff not in administration.  Senior level management has no clue how the programs inpatient and outpatient run nor do they seem to want to know.

job_title: Medical Records in Ocala, FL
pros:
-Good paid leave benefits
-If you're that desperate for experience for your resume, you will find it here
-Health benefits offer decent coverage, but...
cons:
-Want to perform skilled labor for near minimum wage?
-Poor management and lack of funding means you have no future if you decide to stick around. CEO likes to candidly discuss the companies problems with the Ocala Star-Banner, google it.
-Health benefits are very expensive compared to other companies and in proportion to the pay.
-Stressed attitude prevalent among staff.

I don't regret my time here, as the experience bought me a much better position elsewhere, but would I go back? A thousand times NOPE.

review_title: Good place to work and great group of people.
job_title: Family Care Manager in Ocala, FL
pros: My coworkers and supervisors were great to work with and very helpful.  The pay for my position (Family Care Manager) was good, but for my normal field of Accounting, not so good.
cons: Even though we were paid hourly, with no overtime pay, we were expected to be available 24/7, because of our clients.  Also, the amount of paperwork was overwhelming, to say the least!

job_title: Managed Care Specialist in Ocala, FL
pros: I met some great people.
cons: Upper, middle, lower management.  One of the middle managers holds grudges, is brash, a bully, unprofessional. She victimizes then when you stand up for yourself, she plays the victim. No one to turn to while working in that hostile environment. Only one person in my old department got offered and worked over time. No raises, raises were dangled in front of us like carrots.

review_title: Used to be a good company before long-time CEO retired
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Ocala, FL
pros: Progressive PTO leave policy. Great mission.
cons: Seemingly impossible measures imposed by the State for services Florida employees could not adewuately perform themselves with more funding than provided to nonprofits like The Centers.

job_title: Family Care Manager in Ocala, FL
pros: Because they help a wide variety of children and families, they make a big impact on the  community at large.
cons: Due to the nature of their business and not much funding to work with, the employees are overworked for all they need to get accomplished and that causes much stress.

review_title: Enjoyed working with this patient population
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Ocala, FL
pros: Thankful for the opportunity.  Enjoyed working with the clients.  Centers paid for a portion of insurance coverage, if the employee could afford it.  Many could not due to low wages.
cons: Never enough supplies, disorganized, very political.  Compensation for some positions was seriously low.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Ocala, FL
pros: Staff who truly care, provide much needed services to an underserved community
cons: Inexperienced upper management and administration, poor retention due to lack of training and patient to employee ratio

job_title: Registered Nurse in Ocala, FL
pros: Enjoyed working with clients, PTO

review_title: Negative impact on staff during merger with another company

review_title: Very sad deterioration of a once pretty decent place
